body: Just as good as pricier foods! Maybe better! Due to the pandemic we needed to cut costs in a lot of ways including pricey dog food. My three senior/special needs dogs were eating Blue Buffalo for years but to save money we switched to this. The ingredients are very similar, the first ingredient is real meat. Well, to be perfectly honest this dog food has been BETTER than the Blue Buffalo. My dogs love the taste more, especially the chewy meat morsels, their coats are more shiny, they are more active. We also have a Beagle with a thyroid disorder who needs to lose weight. While the Blue Buffalo was about 25 calories less, she actually lost weight and met her goal on this in just 2 months! (Perhaps because she’s moving more and feeling better on this food)I work in the veterinary field. Typically we recommend fancier foods or vet prescription foods. Well this one is just as good if you’re on a budget!Highly recommend for dogs over 9 or even dogs with arthritis as it has glucosamine or for dogs who might need to shed a few pounds, just feed them the recommended amount on the label!

body: Excellent food for less money! My 11 year old cocker spaniel was on Hills Science Diet for his entire life. He always had softer stools but that was kind of normal for him. We wanted to switch him to something for older dogs. The dogs in my family on Purina One have lived a few years longer than those on Science Diet so we figured it was worth a try. Almost immediately when mixing with his old food to switch him we noticed a difference. His stools were much firmer and easier to pick up. I was a bit apprehensive because he does have sensitive skin, but he never had any problems with it. I was also worried it would dull his coat, which is such a beautiful black and white parti with ticking that it’s almost blue in certain lights. However his coat has remained shiny. Also he has had a “knee” replacement in both back legs but he actually seems to get around better on the Purina food. He also lost weight due to the calorie difference which was good at first, but eventually we had to feed a quarter cup more per day to maintain his weight. We are very pleased with the results... and price point!
subject: Purina ONE Senior Dog Food, SmartBlend Vibrant Maturity Adult 7+ Formula - 31.1 lb. Bag

body: Has helped our senior dog's mobility enormously I have a rasty old high-energy Jack Russel/Beagle mix who was very fond of the regular Purina One food, but by about 9 years old he was starting to have major mobility issues. He was slowing down, he couldn't jump up on beds anymore and at times he would almost completely lose control of his back legs for a week or so. I helped him ride through the bad times with pain meds and heating pads and got him stairs so that he could climb up and down on furniture. I was more or less resigned to the fact that this was just how it was going to be going forward.I was generally of the opinion that "puppy" and "senior" dog food labels were primarily marketing terms, but I read around that senior dog food blends did have supporting supplements for joint and muscle issues and he was getting so bad that I thought, what could it hurt to give it a try? There weren't immediate results, he didn't eat a bowl and he was better overnight, but over the last six months I've steadily gotten my rasty, rambunctious dog back. He's notoriously picky about food, but he likes the taste of this. He has put on weight, and he's back to being able to jump up with no problems! His energy has returned, and we haven't had another debilitating back spasm/spine compression issue like Beagles are prone to, knock on wood. He's almost 11 now, and grayer than ever, but he's feeling good enough to be his old obnoxious self, and I'm sure that this food has had a cumulative effect that has helped him to do that.

body: Pancreatitis found in my 10 year old. I have two dogs, both 10 yrs old. Chihuahua and Bossy Bully. A couple weeks ago I had to take the little one into the Vet as he vomited brown liquid. Brown is serious. So after blood tests, he had pancreatitis. So Ive been feeding him all fresh food. Ground turkey, green beans, spinach, rice, sweet potatoes. He cant eat this food or dog treat anymore. I learned it was way too high in fat, which can cause pancreatitis. Not saying this was the culprit, but both dogs need to change their food now. They've been eating this for 2 years when I got my bigger dog. The little one was on science diet before. Im looking into Buffalo and Nutro for seniors/weight management. Their treats are now frozen green beans, blue berries, melon.

I changed to purina pro sensitive stomach, but they hated the taste and don’t finish their food, it also had a strong smell. Blue buffalo’s ground/pate is better and they love that but it is a bit pricier. I will be trying the other flavors to see if they have eggshell pieces too, hopefully not.
